Centruroides vittatus is a nocturnal species that prefers to live in dry, rocky, or wooded habitats. It is a predatory species, feeding on a variety of insects, small arthropods, and even small vertebrates. The scorpion uses its venom to subdue its prey before consuming it.

Despite its widespread distribution and relatively common occurrence, the Centruroides vittatus is an important component of the desert and grassland ecosystems in which it lives, playing a role in the regulation of populations of its prey species.
